column2: Susie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

Prior to the Orlistat shortage in January of 2012 this product was very effective. Alli with Orlistat from India does not work.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: I have been taking Alli for two weeks and have had good results. After reading many replies to this drug one thing people forget is your body has to adjust to the medicine just like any other. The uses say Alli breaks down the fat in foods to smaller pieces and what is not absorbed into the body goes to the bowl. So if you are consuming more than the alotted amount of fat intake for the day, what do you think is going to happen? The extra fat has to go somewhere and would you rather it stay in your body or go out in poo? The first week I did have mild cramping just before a loose stool but as my body adjusted to the medicine, I no longer have the cramps or the diarrhea. Cut back on your fat intake people and the poo's will go away and read the directions thoroughly!

column2: country, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have tried all kinds of diets & diet pills but Alli is the only one that has worked and the only one i have gotten great results from.I have been taking Alli for 4 months now, i have had great results with it, yes there has been some side effects, but that's ok cause that's how i know it's working & i have lost 27lbs since i have been taking Alli.I recommended it to my daughter who is a nurse and she has had great results also, so i recommend Alli to anybody who is serious about loseing weight cause it really does work & it's not real expensive.

column2: countrygirl35754, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: AngelinaBabina, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am on a great many other medications that cause "dryness" and "weightgain" and after breaking my back 3 years ago and going into perimenopause needless to say I was at the END of my rope!!!!! I finally bit the bullet and grabbed both the started pack & the refill pack and jumped head first into it.  I was amazed at how easy it was to follow and to maintain. I have been able to eat normal foods (not expensive yada yada packaged foods) but real store bought easy to prepare foods.! I've lost 42lbs in about 4 months and I've cried many tears of joy to know that I can to return to my ole self again after being inmobile in a brace for over a year and gaining well over 60lbs!.  Even being almost 40yrs old and recovered from a broken back I am able to do a small routine on my ab lounger in the a.m. after my lil one goes to school and another just before going to bed which helps me burn calories while sleeping.  I've also takin up a new hobby of boxing on a puchin bag in my basement :-) very great stress relief for those "type A" Personalities ;-) So far....I have recommended this to so many in my family and I will continue to do so to many more.  I am excited as to the results and wish for many others to find the happiness that I am able to feel and achieve...EVERYONE deserves a lil Happyness!!!!!! Goodluck to you and God Bless , Angela :-) @-}----

column2: mtbroadcaster, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Alli was not helpful at all with in loosing weight.  Perhaps its because when the FDA approved this drug for over the counter, behind the counter it is known as Orlistat, the dose that was approved is not even close to prescription strength.  All I ever get from this drug was horrible urges to use the bathroom and the so called, "treatment" effects.  If interested in the loosing weight consult a physician and discuss the weight loss pill, "Phentermine."  Very good pill that helps curb hunger like  you wouldn't believe.  Along with diet and exercise and changing your life, that pill seems to help greatly!  45 lbs in two months, in my opion, is pretty darn good!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column9: I am really confused with this product. I started out eating right and taking this, and I didn't have any issues with treatment effects, so I wasn't sure if it was working. To test it, I ate a meal with a good deal of fat in it, as I was staying home that afternoon and could be in the bathroom at a moment's notice. Well, nothing happened! So now I am just eating normally and taking it, and I have no side effects, except that I am more gassy now, but the gas isn't accompanied by leakage or stains. I am thinking I have an issue with my own digestive tract, because this doesn't make any sense. I am sorry that some people have had problems with this medication. I have lost 10 pounds, but I can't say that it was all due to this medication because I changed my eating habits at first, and now that I'm back eating normally, its at a standstill.

column2: slim13, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had to review because of all the negative talk about the drug. I have only been on it 2 weeks, the people complaining are obviously not reading the label. Dont eat fatty foods! There are 2 things going on here. Helps you, well almost forces you, to cut down on fat or risks side effects and helps absorb less fat when you do. I am on a strict diet in hopes of losing some weight. I am healthy but I have put on a few extra in the last few years. I exercise and I eat food with almost little to no fat. (Egg white, chicken breast, veggies, salad, and I read every label b4 I eat)Some of these people compalining are probably eating McDonalds and then taking a pill or think they are eating fat free food and not reading the labels. Educate yourself people. I have had no side effects except once when I ate out with the family gave in to a craving and had a burger. I felt some crapping, mild,  but I deserved it. Other than that one time I have never felt a side effect. I eat well. If you eat poorly this drug or any other drug will not work, geez.

column2: jwright, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I took the brand before it became and OTC I took 2 pills and now that it is OTC I still take 2 pills. You only experience the side effects if you eat high fatty foods. The nice thing about this med is it reminds you of what we put our bodies through from eatting bad foods. I have lost weight on the drug. There is no magic bullet you have to eat right and work out. It takes energy to gain weight so it takes energy to lose weight. At least with alli a lot of fat is coming out your body making it eaiser to lose weight.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The treatment is effective combined with exercise.

column2: pixiechick86, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been taking alli since September 2008 and have since lost 60 lbs., my start weight was 296 lbs. I have been overweight my whole life and alli is the only pill I have taken that has helped me to change my life completely.  Not one other diet pill has even began to do what alli has done for me I can't stress it enough! Alli has helped me to make better food choices and to make exercise a part of my everyday life. The alli program has been the easiest program for me to follow and as long as you know how to follow instructions it is as easy as PIE lol!  Yes there are treatment effects but they only happen when you eat something that is over 15g of fat.  Alli is a fat blocker but it also helps you to stick to your diet because if you don't you will get treatment effects. Alli does effect people differently but for the most part you only get treatment effects if you CHEAT ON YOUR DIET!  So stick to your diet and exercise and you won't even feel or see the treatment effects of alli but you will most deffinately see weight loss results.  It's all a mind game and lots of hard work but if there is a will there is a way!  Alli has worked wonders for me and I hope this review will help someone else gain the confidence to proceed with their weight loss goals. Good Luck and God Bless!P.S.  Be sure to get the alli starter pack first b/c they give you an online membership to their website which makes your life easier by providing different tools for your weightloss success!

column2: ChicagoBride, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: I used this pill before my wedding to lose weight. I lost about 10 pounds in six weeks using Alli in the following way: I didn't want to get the oily gross side effects, so I alternated meals. Day One: Take Alli with Breakfast and Dinner (not at lunch)Day Two: Take it with Lunch (not at breakfast or dinner)I didn't have any of the side effects at all, but I was VERY careful not to go above 15 grams of fat at any given meal, even those where I wasn't taking Alli. I did gain the weight back after I stopped taking it, but that was my own fault- I stopped watching my diet and stopped exercising frequently. All in all, I give it a good review- it was extremely effective then, and I've just started taking it again.

I have just been taking Alli for a week, and already feel my clothes are not as tight. I have no bowel side effects at all. However, I do sometimes feel sleepy after taking the pill.  Does anyone have a similar experience? Might be because I forget to take a multi vitamin each day.  Just wondering if any similar experiences.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years
column9: I have been taking alli for about a year now. I wrote my initial review back in November stating that, at that time i had lost approx. 5 pounds and had been taking alli for about a month. Alli has continued to help me lose weight. I take alli for about 2 months at a time, after that I notice I stop losing weight (but don't gain it either as long as I eat right). After a month of being off alli I take it again for 2 months, then off again, on for 2 mo's again and repeat... I have lost a total of 25 pounds to date, about 1/2 pound to a pound a week. (slow moving but hey at least its something) I feel better than I have felt in years. I haven't been at this weight since I was in my 20's. I still have a long way to go, about 45 pounds. If I put a little effort into some exersize i know i would lose faster. Good luck to ALL. Hope you all do well in your weight loss.

column2: Shyloxmom, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Day four here but woke up with moderate flu like symptoms. I found a few boards online which state that could be a side effect. I was really hoping to continue with this but now and not sure. Anyone else have simliar problem?

column2: festivelady826, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have cancer (leiomyosarcoma) and take OxyContin for pain. I don't exercise much anymore, and have gained approximately 30 lbs. in the last 3 years. I bought Alli because my pain meds make me very constipated, and I had read previous reviews about the laxative effects.I love it! I abhor taking laxatives because of the cramping, gas, etc. I take Alli as directed with my meals and I keep them under the recommended 15 grams of fat. I no longer have constipation at all, but I have not had the oily discharge and spotting that others experienced, probably due to the high amount of pain mediciation I take.I lost 8 pounds in one month and I now have regular, painless BM's every day. This drug has been a miracle cure for my constipation and my weight gain! I suffered no ill side effects at all. Note: It is very important to keep your fat grams at or under the recommended amounts. The gas and oily discharge is brought about when one EXCEEDS the fat grams, as the drug cannot process the excess fat. It is very easy for me to stick to this plan by eating Lean Cuisines, or other pre-packaged meals with the caloric/fat gram count on the package. It is truly a no-brainer.

column2: sweetz, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

There's a learning curve, You'll figure out real quick what you can eat and what you can't eat alot of. Before Alli I was constipated always, Not anymore.I love my results. I use it now for maintance.

Enjoy!

column9: i have only been taking alli for a month and have already started losing weight. i have lost about 5 lbs. i have had an accident or two by eating too much fat at one time but have learned my lesson and i am now eating healthier. i have been encouraged by reading the other ratings and hope to continue to lose more weight. i have about 70lbs to go.
I have had looser stools and gas but I am losing weight and am eating a better, more balanced diet.

column2: paddle-girl, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am extremely pleased with this product. I was on a LOW-FAT version of a low-carb diet...for years,... & was stuck in a plateau. I have a verrrry sluggish metabolism. I tried Alli. I found I am eating as before... but started incorporating  either one-half of a low-carb pita bread for sandwiches, OR a bit of rice, OR 1/2 cup of oatmeal in the morning. On top of that.... I exercise like a madwoman...... as before. Did I experience incredible weight loss with ALLI...?    No,.... but I am extremely pleased... as I am actually eating a few  carbs ..usually first thing in the morning. This is amazing...  I have lost 30 pounds so far - in a 3-month period, but I  feel great, feel like I am eating a NORMAL meal now.  I still do not eat white flour, ice-cream, high-fat & high sugar foods. I have not eaten them in 10 years. However I have balance in my life again.  I am SOOOOO HAPPY.   Try this... If you are NOT metabolically resistant like me - you will lose much more quickly,.... but I am abolutely THRILLED with my SUCCESS. P.S. One thing though... It's like having a built-in baby-sitter or guardian watching over you. If you eat too much fat at one meal....   you better stay close to home.... or wear a panty-liner, I now count my fat grams & have been without incident for awhile.   EXREMELY PLEASED WITH THIS PRODUCT.   You will be - TOO...!!!

column2: mistyeyesof7, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I lost 189 pounds on this pill in 6 months then I could not afford the drug anymore since it wasn't on medicaid anymore, Now that they have renamed it it does not cost as much and I looking forward to starting back on it.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
